data.title: Famous Deaths on April 28
data.meta_description: Famous deaths for the 28th of April. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals died throughout history on April 28.
data.text:
Saint Hugh of Cluny, 6th abbot of Cluny, dies at 84

Conrad of Montferrat, King of Jerusalem, assassinated at 52

Henry Percy, 4th Earl of Northumberland, English politician, dies at 40

Nicholas West, English bishop and diplomat, dies at 72

Thomas Betterton, British actor and dramatist (Coriolanus), dies at 74

Louis de Montfort, French catholic priest and saint who preached Mariology (Secret of the Rosary; True Devotion to Mary), dies at 43

Mary Read

English pirate who operated in the Caribbean, dies of a violent fever while in prison and likely still pregnant aged 36

Thomas Pitt, British merchant & Governor of Madras, dies at 72

Magnus Julius De la Gardie, Swedish general and statesman, dies at 73

Giovanni Battista Piazzetta, Italian Rococo painter of religious subjects and genre scenes (Fortune Teller), dies at 72

Marie-Anne de Cupis de Camargo, French dancer, dies at 60

Johann Friedrich Struensee, German physician of Christian VII of Denmark, dies at 34

Cornelius Harnett, American delegate to the Continental Congress, dies at 58

François Giroust, French composer, dies at 62

Hans Gram, Danish composer, dies at 49

Mikhail Kutuzov, Russian field marshal (Battle of Borodino), dies at 67

Johann Heinrich Abicht, German philosopher, dies at 53

Peter Chanel, French priest & saint, dies at 37

William Wallace, Scottish mathematician (rights of Wallace), dies at 74

Ludwig Tieck, German writer, dies at 79

Johannes Peter Müller, German physiologist, made first distinction between motor and sensory nerves, dies at 56

Samuel Cunard, Canadian-British shipping magnate and founder (1st regular Atlantic steamship line), dies at 77

Robert Olinger, American warden & the last victim of Billy the Kid, dies at 31

William M. Browne, American Confederate politician and Brigadier General, dies at 59

Carl Ferdinand Pohl, German-Austrian music historian, organist, and composer, dies at 67

Heinrich von Treitschke, German historian and political writer, dies at 61

Josiah Willard Gibbs, American theoretical physicist and chemist (created statistical mechanics, 1st US doctorate in engineering) dies at 64

Fitzhugh Lee, American Major General (Confederate Army) & 40th Governor of Virginia, dies at 69

Gavrilo Princip

Bosnian-Serb assassin of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, dies of tuberculosis at 23

Paul Deschanel, French politician and eccentric President of France (1920), dies at 67

Louis Bouwmeester, Dutch actor (Shakespeare), dies at 82

Robin Irvine, British actor (Easy Virtue, When Boys Leave Home), dies of pleurisy at 31

Charley Patton, American Delta blues musician ("Pony Blues"; "High Water Everywhere"), dies of a mitral valve disorder between the ages of 37 and 43

Alexander Campbell Mackenzie, Scottish composer, dies at 87

Fuʾād I [Aḥmad Fuʾād Pasha], King of Egypt (1922-36), dies at 68

Frank Knox, American politician (Republican VP candidate 1936), newspaper editor and Secretary of the Navy during World War II, dies at 70

Benito Mussolini

Fascist Italian dictator (1922-43), shot by communist partisans at 61

Claretta Petacci, Italian mistress of Mussolini, executed at 33

1945 Hans Bloesch, Swiss author, dies at 67

1945 Roberto Farinacci, Italian fascist, dies at 52

Louis Bachelier, French mathematician, dies at 76

Aurora Quezon, First Lady of the Philippines, assassinated at 61

Léon Jouhaux, French socialist and co-founder UN's ILO (Nobel Peace Prize 1951), dies at 74

Lode Cantens, Flemish playwright (Gnomes of the City), dies at 43

Heinz Bär, German fighter pilot, dies at 43

Anton Pannekoek, Dutch astronomer, philosopher and Marxist theorist, dies at 87

1960 Carlos Ibáñez del Campo, 19th and 25th President of Chile, dies at 82

Rolf de Maré, Swedish art collector & museum director, dies at 75

Ferdinand Bordewijk, Dutch lawyer and writer (Character), dies at 80

Ralph Bunker, American actor (Ghost Goes West), dies of a stroke at 77

Oscar Comras, American drummer, bandleader, and namesake of Comras Mall in Bronx Park, dies at 51

Johannes Röntgen, Dutch composer, dies at 70

Ed Begley, American actor (12 Angry Men, The Unsinkable Molly Brown), dies at 69

Clas Thunberg

Finnish speed skater (Olympic gold 1500m, 5000m, allround 1924; 500m, 1500m 1928), dies at 80

Jacques Maritain, French Catholic philosopher (exponent of St Thomas), dies at 90

1973 Pat Henning, American actor (Goodyear TV Playhouse), dies at 64

Paul Page, American actor (Girl From Havana, Moth), dies at 70

Jan Aart de Jonge, Dutch historian and writer, dies at 48

Eugen Roth, German poet, dies at 81

1976 Richard Hughes, English writer (Fiction as Truth), dies at 76

Ricardo Cortez [Jacob Krantz], American actor and director (The Maltese Falcon), dies at 76

1977 Sepp Herberger, German soccer manager (Germany 1936–42; West Germany 1950-64) and striker (3 caps; SV Waldhof Mannheim 127 games), dies at 80

Mohammed Daoud Khan, 1st President of Afghanistan (1973-78) & Prime Minister of Afghanistan (1953-63), dies at 68

Feliks Roderyk Łabuński, Polish composer, dies at 86

(Francisco) "Chino" Pozo, Cuban-American latin jazz and Afro-Cuban drummer, bongosero and conguero, dies at 64

1980 Dee Carroll [Betty Jean Marsh], American actress (Mad Bomber, Split), dies at 54

1980 Tommy Caldwell, American rock bass player (Marshall Tucker Band), dies in a jeep crash at 30

Cliff Battles, American College/Pro Football HOF halfback (West Virginia Wesleyan College; 3 x First-Team All-Pro; NFL rushing yards leader 1932, 37; Boston Braves/Redskins, Washington Redskins), dies at 70

1981 Mickey Walker, American boxer (World Welterweight Champion 1922-26; World Middleweight Champion 1926-29), dies at 79

1981 Steve Currie, British rock bassist (T. Rex; Marc Bolan), dies in a car crash in Portugal at 33

Bert van Dongen [Albert Cohen], Dutch singer, impressionist and actor (Het meisje met den blauwen hoed), dies at 66

1982 Nobby Clark, English cricketer (32 wickets in 8 Tests 1929-34), dies at 81

Charlie LaVere [Johnson], American jazz pianist, arranger, bandleader (Chicago Loopers), and composer (Disneyland's Golden Horseshoe Revue), dies at 72

1983 Ron James, Australian cricketer (NSW's Sheffield Shield captain 1949-50), dies at 62

Glen H. Taylor, American senator, dies at 80

1984 Moses "Whispering" Smith, American blues harmonica player and singer ("A Thousand Miles From Nowhere"; "Hound Dog Twist"), dies at 52

1984 Piet Kraak, Dutch soccer goalkeeper (33 caps; Stormvogels, Elinkwijk), dies from a stroke at 55

1984 Silvia Ashton-Warner, New Zealand writer, dies at 76

Åke Olof Sebastian Uddén, Swedish violist, composer and educator (Royal College Of Music, 1934-70), dies at 84

1987 Ben Linder, American engineer, murdered by Contras in Nicaragua at 27

B. W. Stevenson, American country singer, dies at 38

Olaf J. de Landell, Dutch writer, dies at 77

Floyd McKissick, American lawyer and civil rights activist, dies at 69

1991 Ken Curtis, American actor (Festus - Gunsmoke), dies at 74

1991 Steve Broidy, American motion picture executive, dies at 85

Francis Bacon, Irish-British abstract painter (Study for a Pope), dies at 82

1992 Iceberg Slim [Robert Beck], African-American writer, dies at 73

Jim Valvano, American basketball coach (NC State), dies of cancer at 47

Andrew Salkey, Panamanian-born novelist, dies at 67

1995 Henry C. Rogers, American publicist, dies at 81

1995 Peaches Davis, American baseball pitcher, dies at 89

Gilles Grangier, French film director (Archimède le clochard), dies at 84

1996 Henry Clarke, American fashion photographer (Vogue), dies at 78

1996 Julio Cesar Mendez Montenegro, Guatemalan politician, dies at 80

1996 William Colby, American intelligence officer (CIA Director, 1973-76), dies at 76

Ann Lane Petry, American journalist and author (Street), dies at 88

1997 Susan Seddon Boulet, American artist, dies of cancer at 45

Ramakant Desai, Indian cricket fast bowler (28 Tests, 74 wickets, 1 x 50; Bombay), dies from cardiac arrest at 58

Alf Ramsey, English football manager, dies at 79

Arthur Leonard Schawlow

American physicist who shared the 1981 Nobel Prize in Physics for his pioneering work with lasers, dies of leukemia at 77

1999 Rory Calhoun [Francis Timothy McCown], American actor (Blue & Gray, How to Marry a Millionaire), dies of emphysema at 76

1999 Walter Gieseler, German composer, dies at 79

doctor, cancer researcher (Karolinska University Hospital, 1967-92), politician (Member of Parliament, 1991-94), and Holocaust survivor, dies of leukemia at 74

2000 Penelope Fitzgerald, English writer, dies at 83

Ken Hughes, English director (Casino Royale, Chitty, Chitty Bang, Bang), dies at 79

Alexander Lebed, Russian general, dies at 52

Lou Thesz

American professional wrestler, dies at 86

Chris Candido, American wrestler, dies at 33

2005 Percy Heath, American jazz bassist (Modern Jazz Quartet), dies at 81

2005 Taraki Sivaram, Tamil journalist of Sri Lanka, dies at 45

Ben-Zion Orgad, Israeli composer, dies at 79

Bertha Wilson, Canadian lawyer and the 1st woman appointed to the Supreme Court of Canada, dies at 83

2007 Carl Friedrich von Weizsäcker, German physicist and philosopher, dies at 94

2007 Robert "Dabbs" Greer, American actor (Gunsmoke, The Green Mile, Little House on Prairie), dies of a kidney and heart ailment at 90

2007 Tommy Newsom, American saxophonist & bandleader (The Tonight Show), dies at 78

Ekaterina Maximova, Russian ballerina, dies at 70

2009 Valeria Peter Predescu, Romanian singer, dies of a heart attack at 62

2009 Vern Gosdin, American country singer ("Set 'Em Up Joe"), dies after a stroke at 74

William Campbell, American character actor (Cannonball - "Jerry"; Hush… Hush, Sweet Charlotte: Dementia 13), dies at 87

Jackie Kelso [John Joseph Kelson Jr], American jazz saxophonist & session musician, dies at 90

2012 Matilde Camus, Spanish poet and researcher, dies at 92

2012 Patricia Medina, British actress (The Three Musketeers, High-Low), dies from natural causes at 92

János Starker, Hungarian-American cellist, dies at 88

2013 Lonnie Turner, American rock and blues bassist (Steve Miller Band - "Fly Like An Eagle"), dies of lung cancer at 66

Dennis Kamakahi, American Grammy Award-winning slack-key guitarist, dies from lung cancer at 61

2014 Idris Sardi, Indonesian violinist and composer, noted for his film scores, dies at 75

2014 Jack Ramsay, American Hall of Fame basketball coach (Portland Trail Blazers, 1977 NBA Champions), dies from cancer at 89

2014 Richard Kenshaw, British broadcaster, dies at 80

Jack Ely, American singer and guitarist (The Kingsmen - "Louie, Louie"), dies at 71

Barry Howard, British comic actor (Hi-de-Hi!), dies of blood cancer at 78

2016 Conrad Burns, American politician (Senate-R-Montana 1989-2007), dies at 81

2016 Jenny Diski, English writer (Stranger on a Train), dies of cancer at 68

Luis Olmo, Puerto Rican NBA player (Brooklyn Dodgers), dies at 97

Bobby Lewis, American rock and roll singer ("Tossin' and Turnin'"), dies at 95

2020 Eddy Pieters Graafland, Dutch soccer goalkeeper (47 caps; Ajax; European Cup 1970, Feyenoord), dies at 86

2020 Jill Gascoine, British stage and pioneering TV actress (The Gentle Touch - "Maggie Forbes"), and novelist, dies of Alzheimer's disease at 83

2020 Louis Cardiet, French soccer defender (6 caps; Stade Rennais FC, Paris SG), dies at 77

2020 Michael Robinson, Irish soccer striker (24 caps, Republic of Ireland; Brighton & Hove Albion) and Spanish TV host (Canal+, El día después), dies from melanoma at 61

Anita Lane, Australian rock singer-songwriter (The Bad Seeds - "From Her To Eternity"), dies at 61

Astronaut Michael Collins

American Major General USAF and astronaut (Gemini 10, Apollo 11), dies of cancer at 90 [1]

Jim Fox, British pentathlete (Olympics gold team 1976), dies at 81

2023 Taini Jamison (née Royal), New Zealand netball coach (New Zealand 1967-71; World C'ship 1967), dies at 95

William Calley Jr., American war criminal, convicted by court-martial of murdering 22 unarmed South Vietnamese civilians in the My Lai Massacre, dies at 80

April 28 Highlights
